Overall, it’s become a staple in my skincare routine, and I’d highly recommend it to anyone with oily, acne prone, or sensitive skin.

customer_review_001.review: I am in my mid-forties and I have oily, slightly olive skin, which used to be prone to breakouts, but is now smooth and completely free of wrinkles. I have used up two tubes of this product, which I've purchased both in-store and online. It is an effective formula for sensitive skin. I love the design of the tube, which dispenses the product in modest amounts and in its entirety; when I got towards the end of the tube, I didn't have to cut it open to get any residual product out, it emptied perfectly, and you can see this, as the tube is transparent. Both of these factors, (physical ease of use and transparency of packaging), are holy grails for me as a consumer! Very good product design in terms of packaging. It doesn't sting and my skin is left feeling and looking smooth. As I had considerable pigmentation prior to using it, I noticed more than 50% reduction, I'd say close to 80% reduction in pigmentation, which continues to improve over time. So it exceeds the manufacturer's estimates its effectiveness, in my experience. Another big tick there. I like the fact that in addition to salicylic acid, it also contains zinc PCA, which helps heal and stabilise the skin. It lasts about four months or so with twice daily use. Going back for another tube soon. I highly recommend this product to maintain skin clarity and even out skin tone.

I just come across this cleanser randomly on a TikTok and thought why not? Even though I love my cetaphil (which I still use). Maybe for some reason I was drawn to it because whilst this brand seems decent, I still viewed it as an expensive hype and I find their products confusing. Take my money though!! This product is actually so cheap for what it is. I swear it has in only just a week made such a difference. My skin feels amazing after I cleanse with this. I use it every night. customer_review_001.review_title: A Pleasant Surprise for Mature Skin
customer_review_001.review: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] At 51, I wasn’t sure this serum would suit my skin — I expected it might be drying or not hydrating enough. But after using it for about a month, I’m genuinely impressed! The fragrance is fresh and uplifting, and the price point is excellent for the quality. It delivered on its promises — my skin feels plump, hydrated, and brighter, with no dryness at all. It’s also a fantastic base for makeup: non-greasy, quick to absorb, and works beautifully under foundation. I’ll definitely be repurchasing — it’s earned a permanent spot in my skincare routine.

customer_review_002.review: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been using the Garnier Vitamin C Brightening Serum for several weeks now, applying it diligently both in the morning and at night to my face and neck. This serum features a vibrant yellow color and a lightweight, runny consistency that absorbs rapidly into the skin, leaving no sticky or greasy residue behind. One of the standout benefits I've experienced is its remarkable ability to diminish age spots and dark patches, resulting in a noticeably brighter and more even complexion. My skin feels significantly smoother and radiates a healthy glow. Additionally, the serum layers beautifully under moisturizers, making it a breeze to incorporate into my daily skincare routine. I also appreciate its delightful fragrance; unlike many other serums that tend to be odorless, this one has a pleasant scent that enhances the overall experience. Moreover, it’s quite budget-friendly compared to other products available on the market. The convenient dropper allows for precise control over the amount dispensed, ensuring that just a small quantity is all you need for effective results. Overall, I’m very satisfied with this serum and its performance.

customer_review_003.review: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been using this serum for a few weeks now and it hasn’t disappointed. My favourite part about this is that it is more than just a vitamin c serum. It has niacinamide and salicylic acid. Both of these ingredients along with the vitamin c has helped give my skin a smoother and overall brighter look. It also has melasyl in it which is meant to help with dark spots. I have seen some improvement in my dark spots but I can’t say that it’s been significant in the short time that I have used it. The texture of the product is quite nice and it has a pleasant smell. It absorbs into my skin quite easily without making me feel greasy. It’s a great serum that wear well under makeup also.

customer_review_004.review: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Garnier Vitamin C Serum can improve brightness, fade newer dark spots, and smooth skin texture with regular use. It tends to feel non-greasy, lightweight, absorbs well, often with a mild citrus fragrance. Because it has several actives, it can combine brightening + mild exfoliation + calming, which means fewer separate products needed. However, the citrus scent and other fragranced components can irritate sensitive skin. Also, Vitamin C is sensitive to light and air, so a transparent bottle or frequent exposure may reduce effectiveness due to oxidation. Overall, it is affordable and worth trying.

It’s also really satisfying to apply - when you tap it into your skin you can feel the primer turn from a smooth consistency into the grippiness it promises. However, in my experience the primer did not have any effect on how long my makeup lasted. I didn’t notice any difference between how my makeup lasted using this primer and no primer at all. All in all I would likely not repurchase the product because a key requirement of a primer in my opinion is that it makes makeup last longer.

This sunscreen is quite different to others in formulation - it is highly water proof and doesn't come off until a hot shower or manually rubbing off with some effort.
